description: Consent given by a patient to a surgical or medical procedure or participation in a study, examination or analysis after achieving an understanding of the relevant medical facts and the risks involved.
A unique proper name or character sequence that identifies this particular signed individual consent.
Reference to the person (i.e. subject) to whom this individual consent applies.

Reference to the informed consent form that was signed. Points to a particular instance of leaflet and consent form that usually exists as a record (i.e. a row) within the same database as this individual consent.
Indicates the institute who performed the collection act.
A date specification that designates when this individual consent form was signed.
Starting date of the validity of this individual consent.
End date of the validity of this individual consent.
An individual who is authorized under applicable State or local law to consent on behalf of a child or incapable person to general medical care including participation in clinical research.

A data item that is used to indicate consent permissions for datasets and/or materials, and relates to the purposes for which datasets and/or material might be used. In JRC-CDE: 'Consent to the reuse of data' and 'Biological sample'

Data use modifiers indicate additional conditions for use. For instance, a dataset is restricted to investigations into specific diseases or performed at specific geographical locations. In JRC-CDE: 'Consent to the reuse of data' and 'Biological sample'

Further specification of applied data use permissions and modifiers. For example, a list of countries in case of geographic restrictions or a list of diseases when restricted to disease-specific research.

The procedure of recontacting the patient for specified reasons. This means the patient agrees to be re-identifiable under those circumstances. In JRC-CDE: Agreement to be contacted for research purposes

A document explaining all the relevant information to assist an individual in understanding the expectations and risks in making a decision about a procedure. This document is presented to and signed by the individual or guardian.
A unique proper name or character sequence that identifies this document
A classification of the document (e.g., leaflet, consent for clinical study, consent for intervention, etc.)
A title or name given to the document
The version, edition, or adaptation of this document
The date on which this document was approved (e.g., ethnical approval, regulatory approval, etc.)
The date on which this document is valid
The last date on which this document is valid
The persons involved in creating or maintaining this document
A reference to the file and the current location
Reference to one or more relevant documents
